pullRequest.title: Issue #9071: New keyword throwing unresolvable indentation errors
pullRequest.bodyText:
Have to make a PR to pgjdbc with commit: Abhishek-kumar09/pgjdbc@62980e9 once this PR is merged.


New Keyword was being checked at multiple times, one inside its own handler and one by the lineWrappingHandler.
Changed code to give all the powers to only newHandler.
Fixes #9071
Diff Regression projects:https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Abhishek-kumar09/058b09d678ca071caa8c6567cb6ab59e/raw/c5bd6edf0653b9e14d1eb960eb6a8dc299e857f8/projec
Diff Regression config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/Abhishek-kumar09/0745ecf11934e0214b9187f9d4896e4a/raw/2143ba7f21dcafb998019a1ca2c0ee3f1c510646/my_check.xml

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@ public static void main(String[] args) { //indent:2 exp:2
     .length(); //indent:4 exp:>=8 warn
 
     int length2 =  //indent:4 exp:4
-    new ClassWithChainedMethods("param1","param2") //indent:4 exp:>=8 warn
+    new ClassWithChainedMethods("param1","param2") //indent:4 exp:4

nodes.bodyText:
linewrapping is 4.
So should be //indent:20 exp: 16 warn
we should not suggest indentation of 12 as it will be violation.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -83,8 +83,8 @@
         @Override //indent:8 exp:8
         public String toString() { //indent:8 exp:8
             return //indent:12 exp:12
-                    new String( //indent:20 exp:20
-                            new StringBuilder("Hello") //indent:28 exp:28
+                    new String( //indent:20 exp:12,16 warn

nodes.bodyText: is it because they have their own handlers ?

diff report is heavily polluted by such update
can we avoid such wording update ?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -668,8 +668,8 @@ public void testInvalidMethodWithChecker()
             "110:15: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_ERROR, "operator new", 14, 16),
             "113:11: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_CHILD_ERROR, "method call", 10, 12),
             "118:15: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_ERROR, "operator new", 14, 16),
-            "122:11: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_ERROR, "new", 10, 12),
-            "126:11: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_ERROR, "new", 10, 12),
+            "122:11: " + getCheckMessage(MSG_ERROR, "operator new", 10, 12),

nodes.bodyText:
isForceStrictCond is a bad name for a variable. Why not isForceStrictCondition or forceStrictCondition?
If a line does not fit, you can add overload to isAcceptable method. Something like IndentLevel.isAcceptable(int indent, boolean isForceStrictCondition). Then it will add a bit of readability.
